oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Franklin Fordyce to his cousin "Sallie"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Corp. Franklin Fordyce, 84th Regiment, Ind. Inf., Federal from camp near "Bools [sic] Gap" in East Tennessee. Author writes that "we are on the R-Road runing from Knoxville to Linchburgh the Distance of 250 miles." He continues, "I think there is a fare prospect of a speedy close of this war our armys are victorious everywhere we can hear from them if the Rebels don't get out of Richmond before long I don't think they will have a chance to get out until he surrenders to General Grant."
